So, does this mean that I can't use Kopernicus 0.0.6? I'm trying to create my own planet, and it's a gas giant - and it appears to me that it isn't showing up in the tracking station or anywhere.

> 
> So, does this mean that I can't use Kopernicus 0.0.6? I'm trying to create my own planet, and it's a gas giant - and it appears to me that it isn't showing up in the tracking station or anywhere.

Yep, you can't. If you wanna create planets in 1.0, you must use one of the newest dev versions, or use Kopernicus from New horizonts or Kerbol Plus. Don't use OPM's one since, from what I understand, it is a bit different from regular kopernicus. Also, if you want to make an atmospheric planet like a gas giant, you should get in touch with KillAshley. For the rest, I could help you.

Well, I am using the version that came with Kerbol Plus - I'll make a "terrestrial" planet for KSP and that will probably tell me if I did things correctly.

I will reply to tell you about the results.

Edit: none of my planets show up - is there a way to fix this?

- - - Updated - - -

Hey dude I found your mistake: you are using Kittopia space to load planets. You should create them after how we did our planets. Just check our configs and folder placement, it should be preety easy to understand and clean to use as example. For example, for a basic planet, just use Ganag as model, to see how your config should look. Also, do not use Kittopia! We only used it to add that cryovolcano on Potatus and Corolet's comet. If you look in our confogs, the only things you should modify, are texture paths, name, flightGlobalsIndex, orbital caracteristics and deformity (sets how deforemd will your planet look and ot is under where you should specify height map texture path). You also nead a height map I suppose you have, but not used. If you want, I could help you with the textures! 

BTW, create a new dev thread for your mod so we keep this discussion away from Kerbol Plus. Cheers and send me a link to the new thread! I'm right now improving the textures for you!

- - - Updated - - -

Here ya go. The improved color map. For a height map, just turn the normal to greyscale. Also, you can use the same greyscale normal for height. 

![Wg9RVhB](http://imgur.com/Wg9RVhB)
